alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Del Norte Vicinity, Northern San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 10:44AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Alamosa, western Huerfano, Custer and southeastern Saguache Counties through 1115 AM MDT... At 1043 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Crestone Peak to San Luis Valley Airport. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alamosa, San Luis Valley Airport, western Junkins Burn Scar, Crestone, Hooper, Great Sand Dunes, Crestone Peak, Alamosa East, San Luis Lake, Mosca, Silver Cliff, Westcliffe and Rosita. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
